info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, southwestern Berkshire and southeastern Columbia Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1235 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Copake, or 10 miles southwest of Great Barrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Copake, Sheffield, Canaan, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, New Marlborough, Monterey, Alford, Whitehouse Crossing, Hartsville, Weed Mines, Newsboy Statue, Mount Riga, Williamsville, Alander, Southfield, Taconic, North Egremont and Joyceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
